While there is no specific time of day that is known to be more effective for increasing gamma wave production through meditation, some studies have suggested that morning meditation may be more beneficial for some individuals.

The reason for this is that our brains tend to be more alert and active in the morning, which may make it easier to access certain brainwave states, including gamma waves. Additionally, practicing meditation in the morning can set the tone for the day, helping to promote a calmer, more focused state of mind.

That being said, the effectiveness of meditation in increasing gamma wave production does not necessarily depend on the time of day. Other factors, such as the length and consistency of the practice, the type of meditation, and the individual's own experiences and preferences, can also play a role.

In general, the best time for meditation is the time that works best for you and your schedule, as a consistent practice is key to experiencing the benefits of meditation over time.
